newsitem.title: NIGERIA: U.N. Bakassi mission to visit Nigeria, Cameroon.
newsitem.headline: U.N. Bakassi mission to visit Nigeria, Cameroon.

text.p: A U.N. mission will examine the dispute between Nigeria and Cameroon over the Bakassi peninsula, the Nigerian national news agency said on Wednesday.

The News Agency of Nigeria said the United Nations mission, to be led by Indonesian Omar Halim, would leave New York on Friday and last 13 days, involving consultations with both governments. It would also visit the disputed area.
"The mission's mandate includes gathering information and formulating suggestions which might help the parties to adopt confidence-building measures," the agency said.
The first stop on the mission's schedule is the Cameroon capital, Yaounde.
Since February 1994, Nigerian and Cameroonian troops have clashed repeatedly over the string of impoverished islands which form the Bakassi peninsula in the oil-rich Gulf of Guinea.
In March, the International Court of Justice at the Hague ordered the two sides to halt hostilities pending its final decision on who owns the peninsula.
